  "title": "Service Centre Supervisor",
  "description": "Xiaomi Limited was founded in April 2010 as a consumer electronics and smart manufacturing company with smartphones and smart hardware connected by an IoT platform at its core.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Service Centre Supervisor
Job Location:&nbsp;Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Service Centre Supervisor oversees the daily operations of the service center to ensure efficient workflow, high-quality service delivery, and customer satisfaction.
	The role involves managing technicians, store keepers and customer service staff, monitoring repairs and service processes, enforcing company policies, and ensuring smooth coordination between departments.


Key Responsibilities
Operations Management:


	Supervise day-to-day operations of the service center, ensuring timely and efficient service delivery.
	Monitor job queues, allocate tasks to technicians, and ensure prompt turnaround of customer devices.
	Enforce operational standards, quality control, and adherence to repair timelines.
	Ensure a clean, organized, and safe work environment at all times.


Staff Supervision &amp; Performance:


	Supervise technicians and customer service personnel to ensure productivity and professionalism.
	Conduct daily briefings and assign duties to team members.
	Monitor attendance, punctuality, and performance.
	Identify training needs and support capacity-building for team members.


Customer Service:


	Ensure excellent customer experience through prompt, courteous, and transparent service.
	Handle escalated complaints and resolve complex service issues.
	Maintain strong relationships with customers by ensuring clear communication and regular updates on repair progress.
	Oversee the issuance of receipts, quotations, and service reports.


Reporting &amp; Documentation:


	Maintain accurate records of all repairs, parts used, and completed jobs.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly performance reports to management.
	Track and manage service requests, warranty claims, and returns.


Inventory &amp; Equipment Control:


	Monitor spare parts inventory and ensure proper stock management.
	Request replacement parts as needed and verify their quality before use.
	Ensure all tools, diagnostic equipment, and systems are well-maintained and properly utilized.


Compliance &amp; Policy Enforcement:


	Ensure all staff adhere to company policies, safety regulations, and service protocols.
	Implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and reduce service errors.
	Promote teamwork, professionalism, and accountability across all departments.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Minimum of HND qualification / B.Sc Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.
	3 - 5 years of experience in service center or operations management (electronics, telecoms).
	Proven ability to lead teams and manage operational workflows.
	Strong communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficient in MS Office tools and basic service management systems.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

Service Centre Supervisor Job at Xiaomi Limited




        
    

        
        Xiaomi Limited was founded in April 2010 as a consumer electronics and smart manufacturing company with smartphones and smart hardware connected by an IoT platform at its core.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Service Centre Supervisor
Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Service Centre Supervisor oversees the daily operations of the service center to ensure efficient workflow, high-quality service delivery, and customer satisfaction.
	The role involves managing technicians, store keepers and customer service staff, monitoring repairs and service processes, enforcing company policies, and ensuring smooth coordination between departments.


Key Responsibilities
Operations Management:


	Supervise day-to-day operations of the service center, ensuring timely and efficient service delivery.
	Monitor job queues, allocate tasks to technicians, and ensure prompt turnaround of customer devices.
	Enforce operational standards, quality control, and adherence to repair timelines.
	Ensure a clean, organized, and safe work environment at all times.


Staff Supervision & Performance:


	Supervise technicians and customer service personnel to ensure productivity and professionalism.
	Conduct daily briefings and assign duties to team members.
	Monitor attendance, punctuality, and performance.
	Identify training needs and support capacity-building for team members.


Customer Service:


	Ensure excellent customer experience through prompt, courteous, and transparent service.
	Handle escalated complaints and resolve complex service issues.
	Maintain strong relationships with customers by ensuring clear communication and regular updates on repair progress.
	Oversee the issuance of receipts, quotations, and service reports.


Reporting & Documentation:


	Maintain accurate records of all repairs, parts used, and completed jobs.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly performance reports to management.
	Track and manage service requests, warranty claims, and returns.


Inventory & Equipment Control:


	Monitor spare parts inventory and ensure proper stock management.
	Request replacement parts as needed and verify their quality before use.
	Ensure all tools, diagnostic equipment, and systems are well-maintained and properly utilized.


Compliance & Policy Enforcement:


	Ensure all staff adhere to company policies, safety regulations, and service protocols.
	Implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and reduce service errors.
	Promote teamwork, professionalism, and accountability across all departments.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Minimum of HND qualification / B.Sc Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.
	3 - 5 years of experience in service center or operations management (electronics, telecoms).
	Proven ability to lead teams and manage operational workflows.
	Strong communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficient in MS Office tools and basic service management systems.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

  "description": "Mecer Consulting Limited provides business and management, consulting, general training, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Officer (Microfinance / Cooperative Institution)
Job Location:&nbsp;Kubwa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily operational activities including account management, deposits, withdrawals, and loan processing.
	Ensure compliance with internal control procedures, regulatory standards, and risk management policies.
	Conduct periodic operational reviews to detect and prevent errors, fraud, and irregularities.
	Support the Head of Operations in process improvement and documentation of workflows.
	Prepare and reconcile daily transaction reports.
	Ensure smooth running of banking systems and maintain data accuracy.
	Collaborate with auditors and compliance teams during routine checks.


Requirements


	Minimum of B.Sc/HND in Banking, Finance, Accounting, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in operations within a bank, MFI, MFB, or cooperative institution.
	Proven experience in Internal Control, process monitoring, or compliance functions.
	Proficiency in banking software applications (e.g., Core Banking Systems, BankOne, or similar platforms).
	Strong analytical, documentation, and reconciliation skills.
	Sound understanding of regulatory policies, operational risks, and financial reporting.
	Excellent attention to detail, integrity, and ability to multitask under pressure.


Method of Application&nbsp;
